RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Engenheiro de Materiais pela Universidade do Vale do Paraba - UniVap (2002), mestre em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA (2009) e doutor em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica nas reas de Materiais, Manufatura e Automao tambm pelo ITA (2017). Em seu doutorado no Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA, Marcio desenvolveu um mtodo para desenhar peas metlicas para Manufatura Aditiva - DFAM, que compreende a avaliao da funo da pea, otimizao de material, desenho de produto para a tecnologia e diretrizes para fabricao, verificao e auxlio tomada de deciso. Marcio tem 5 anos de experincia nas tecnologias de fabricao de pr-formas por Manufatura Aditiva a fio e peas diretas por Fuso Seletiva a Laser em leito de p, colaborando com pesquisadores e engenheiros para desenvolver solues, tais como desenho para a tecnologia, a fim de aplicar a Manufatura Aditiva de peas metlicas na indstria aeronutica. Marcio engenheiro da Embraer e em 2004 ele passou a atuar na equipe de P&D da Engenharia de Manufatura. Em 2013, ele assumiu o projeto de desenvolvimento da Manufatura Aditiva de peas metlicas, cujas responsabilidades incluem a gesto, desenvolvimento e capacitao para industrializar peas metlicas por Manufatura Aditiva, bem como colaborar na elaborao de normas, procedimentos, treinamentos e suporte para a aplicao da tecnologia.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: B.S. in Materials Engineering by the Universidade do Vale do Paraba - UniVap (2002), M.S. in Aeronautical and Mechanical Engineering by the Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA (2009) and Ph.D. in Aeronautical and Mechanical Engineering, research field in Materials, Manufacturing and Automation also by the Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA (2017). In his PhD at the Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA), Marcio developed a design for additive manufacturing method (DFAM) of direct metal lightweight parts, which comprises the workpiece function assessment, material optimization, design and manufacturing guidelines, verification and decision making approach. Marcio has 5 years of Wire Additive Layer Manufacturing (WALM) and Laser Powder Bed Fusion (LPBF) experience, collaborating with researchers and engineers to develop new technical solutions, design methods and AM technology application in the aircraft industry. Marcio is engineer at Embraer and in 2004, he joined the Embraer Manufacturing R&D team. In 2013, he assumed the development project of Additive Manufacturing process for metals parts, whose responsibilities include developing and industrializing metal AM parts, as well as standardizing, teaching, and application support of AM technologies.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Marcio engenheiro da Embraer e em 2004, ele passou a atuar na equipe de P&D da Engenharia de Manufatura. Em 2013, ele assumiu o projeto de desenvolvimento da Manufatura Aditiva de peas metlicas, cujas responsabilidades incluem a gesto, desenvolvimento e capacitao para industrializar peas metlicas por Manufatura Aditiva, bem como colaborar na elaborao de normas, procedimentos, treinamentos e suporte para a aplicao da tecnologia.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Marcio is engineer at Embraer and in 2004, he joined the Embraer Manufacturing R&D team. In 2013, he assumed the development project of Additive Manufacturing process for metals parts, whose responsibilities include developing and industrializing metal AM parts, as well as standardizing, teaching, and application support of AM technologies.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Evaluation of The Friction Stir Welding Process for Aeronautical Application
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Investigate the characteristics of the friction stir welding process and develop a prove of concept comprising design for manufacturing, process design, material characterization and development of equipment and devices in order to evaluate the potential of this technology in airframe application.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Investigate the characteristics of the friction stir welding process and develop a prove of concept comprising design for manufacturing, process design, material characterization and development of equipment and devices in order to evaluate the potential of this technology in airframe application.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Evaluation of The Friction Stir Welding Process for Aeronautical Application

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Investigation of the characteristics and mechanical properties of a TiAl6V4 part made by Selective Laser Melting for a structural aerospace application
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Additive manufacturing provides modeling freedom in terms of component geometry and presents potential for component integration, reduction of product development cycle, structural improvement and material efficiency. Metal structural parts are a challenge for additive manufacturing technologies. In order to achieve adequate results it is essential to know the achievable material and component properties.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Additive manufacturing provides modeling freedom in terms of component geometry and presents potential for component integration, reduction of product development cycle, structural improvement and material efficiency. Metal structural parts are a challenge for additive manufacturing technologies. In order to achieve adequate results it is essential to know the achievable material and component properties.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Investigation of the characteristics and mechanical properties of a TiAl6V4 part made by Selective Laser Melting for a structural aerospace application

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Friction stir welding spindle downforce and other control techniques, systems and methods Patent number: 8261959 Abstract: Friction stir welding equipment control force spindle for mounting in an orbital head housing uses a coaxial sensor to measure downforce. Simultaneously, an axial electrical actuator is controlled to dynamically correct the axial tool position during the welding, by a direct axial force system control, in order to maintain controlled downforce according to parameters previously set, based on numerical control. The equipment also sets up, monitors and controls spindle rotation speed, welding speed, acceleration speed and downforce using for example closed loop control functions. A laser system may scan the backing surface before welding and correct original tool path, in order to get an offset tool path. A precision alarm system may provide safe welding while preventing the tool from colliding with the backing surface.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Friction stir welding spindle downforce and other control techniques, systems and methods Patent number: 8261959 Abstract: Friction stir welding equipment control force spindle for mounting in an orbital head housing uses a coaxial sensor to measure downforce. Simultaneously, an axial electrical actuator is controlled to dynamically correct the axial tool position during the welding, by a direct axial force system control, in order to maintain controlled downforce according to parameters previously set, based on numerical control. The equipment also sets up, monitors and controls spindle rotation speed, welding speed, acceleration speed and downforce using for example closed loop control functions. A laser system may scan the backing surface before welding and correct original tool path, in order to get an offset tool path. A precision alarm system may provide safe welding while preventing the tool from colliding with the backing surface.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PROCESSOS-OU-TECNICAS.TITULO-DO-PROCESSO: FRICTION STIR WELDING (FSW) METHODS AND SYSTEMS AND FRICTION STIR WELDED COMPONENTS MADE THEREBY
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PROCESSOS-OU-TECNICAS.TITULO-DO-PROCESSO-INGLES: FRICTION STIR WELDING (FSW) METHODS AND SYSTEMS AND FRICTION STIR WELDED COMPONENTS MADE THEREBY

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Indstrias de Transformao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Patent application number US7857191 USPTO - United States Patents and Trademark Office
FRICTION STIR WELDING (FSW) METHODS AND SYSTEMS AND FRICTION STIR WELDED COMPONENTS MADE THEREBY. Friction stir welding (FSW) processes, systems and the resulting friction stir welded components are disclosed whereby first and second workpieces are welded to one another using a first workpiece having mutually orthogonal structural components and a junction region therebetween which defines a bearing surface of predetermined geometry. A shoulder of a FSW tool may be brought into bearing contact with the bearing surface so that a pin extending from the shoulder of the FSW tool may be advanced into and through the one structural component of the first workpiece at an angle relative thereto so as to thereby form a friction stir weld region between the first and second workpieces. Some preferred embodiments will provide a bearing surface which defines an arcuately concave geometry, in which case the shoulder of the FSW tool defines an arcuately convex geometry conformably mateable with the bearing surface. According to other preferred embodiments, the bearing surface defines an arcuately convex geometry, in which case the shoulder of the FSW tool defines an arcuately concave geometry conformably mateable with the bearing surface. According to yet other preferred embodiments, the bearing surface and the shoulder of the FSW tool are each planar.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Patent application number 20090311549 USPTO - United States Patents and Trademark Office
FRICTION STIR WELDING (FSW) METHODS AND SYSTEMS AND FRICTION STIR WELDED COMPONENTS MADE THEREBY. Friction stir welding (FSW) processes, systems and the resulting friction stir welded components are disclosed whereby first and second workpieces are welded to one another using a first workpiece having mutually orthogonal structural components and a junction region therebetween which defines a bearing surface of predetermined geometry. A shoulder of a FSW tool may be brought into bearing contact with the bearing surface so that a pin extending from the shoulder of the FSW tool may be advanced into and through the one structural component of the first workpiece at an angle relative thereto so as to thereby form a friction stir weld region between the first and second workpieces. Some preferred embodiments will provide a bearing surface which defines an arcuately concave geometry, in which case the shoulder of the FSW tool defines an arcuately convex geometry conformably mateable with the bearing surface. According to other preferred embodiments, the bearing surface defines an arcuately convex geometry, in which case the shoulder of the FSW tool defines an arcuately concave geometry conformably mateable with the bearing surface. According to yet other preferred embodiments, the bearing surface and the shoulder of the FSW tool are each planar.
